blog.name: valyrhos
blog.title: Piecing Together Character Arcs
blog.description:
Hi, I'm Rheia, I love spending my life overanalysing fantasy novels. Welcome to my descent into madness.
We Stan Daenerys in this household.

summary: Arya killing the Night King feels like Ser Pounce being the Prince that was Promised, like you can justify it sure, but the same...
body: Arya killing the Night King feels like Ser Pounce being the Prince that was Promised, like you can justify it sure, but the same issue remains. Arya has the same investment and involvement with the Night King as a fucking cat in King’s Landing. A cat with a Valyrian steel dagger in its mouth might as well kill the Big Bad, for as much sense as it makes to have Arya do it.

reblog.comment: Arya killing the Night King feels like Ser Pounce being the Prince that was Promised, like you can justify it sure, but the same issue remains. Arya has the same investment and involvement with the Night King as a fucking cat in King’s Landing. A cat with a Valyrian steel dagger in its mouth might as well kill the Big Bad, for as much sense as it makes to have Arya do it.

trail.content_raw: Arya killing the Night King feels like Ser Pounce being the Prince that was Promised, like you can justify it sure, but the same issue remains. Arya has the same investment and involvement with the Night King as a fucking cat in King’s Landing. A cat with a Valyrian steel dagger in its mouth might as well kill the Big Bad, for as much sense as it makes to have Arya do it.
trail.content: Arya killing the Night King feels like Ser Pounce being the Prince that was Promised, like you can justify it sure, but the same issue remains. Arya has the same investment and involvement with the Night King as a fucking cat in King’s Landing. A cat with a Valyrian steel dagger in its mouth might as well kill the Big Bad, for as much sense as it makes to have Arya do it.

blog.name: valyrhos
blog.title: Piecing Together Character Arcs
blog.description:
Hi, I'm Rheia, I love spending my life overanalysing fantasy novels. Welcome to my descent into madness.
We Stan Daenerys in this household.

title: Direwolf Symbolism (ASoIaF)
body:
The direwolves of ASoIaF were the first things ever to exist in the series, the scene of the Starks finding them was the first thing GRRM ever thought of that eventually led to the books we know and love, plus the TV show we watched. Every single direwolf tells you so much about its corresponding kid, packed with a whole bunch of symbolism. 

For starters, every direwolf mirrors the personality of the kid- Grey Wind was fierce in battle, stern, and intelligent like Robb. Lady, for the short time that we knew her, was quiet and gentle like early Sansa. Summer is Bran in most aspects, as he gains Bran’s intelligence whenever he is warged. Summer notably tries to climb a tree, despite being a wolf, because he is Bran’s. Nymeria is just like Arya too, being adventurous, and violent. Very violent, Arya and Nymeria have a sort of positive feedback loop in their violence, for the Night Wolf, their combined personality, is a mankiller leading hundreds of wolves, killing Lannisters like a champion. That too is similar to Rickon and Shaggydog, Rickon is repeatedly described as being ‘wild’, and Shaggydog repeatedly savages and bites humans. Ghost is silent like broody Jon, but seems to be a good deal smarter than his human. It’s helpful to remember that, in the books, every single Stark kid is a warg. Robb and Grey Wind fight ‘like one’, Sansa unfortunately never gets the opportunity to warg Lady, Bran is the most obvious example, Arya wargs Nymeria every night, as well as stray Braavosi cats, and we never see Rickon’s perspective, but he too is very close to his wolf. Jon wargs Ghost in his sleep, and Varamyr Sixskins confirms that he is a powerful warg.

All of that is mostly surface-level, however. It’s pretty obvious that the Starks warg their wolves and have similar personalities, but what I like about the wolves is how they represent life and Stark identity. Also, the placement of the direwolves when they are first found is important. If you were to compare it to a family tree, you have the mother direwolf, lying dead on the ground, the five underneath her, and then Ghost, a white direwolf (white like Targaryen hair?) is off to the side, like a cousin would be. Jon is a cousin to the Stark kids.

The deaths of the direwolves hold meaning too. Sansa is a Stark, but she is the least Stark of all the kids. Sansa looks like a Tully, is south for the entire story, and her direwolf dies very early on. The death of Lady can be interpreted as the death of Sansa’s Stark identity or status, distancing her from the other children. Similairly, Arya sends away Nymeria, she sends away a crucial part of her person, which ties into her themes of the loss of identity, while putting the notion that, it is not dead, only sent away. Arya is never truly able to give up being Arya Stark, because Nymeria is not dead and gone, only away temporarily. Arya loses her identity but she will likely regain it in the next two books. Robb never loses his Stark status in this way, instead he dies with his wolf, he dies a Stark. RIckon is currently absent in the books, but it is likely he will die in that same way, with his wolf, Rickon will likely die a Stark. Summer is not yet dead, but it is likely that, in the effort to truly become the three-eyed crow, he will die like in the show, and Bran will cease to be a Stark, and start being a crow. 

I find that Nymeria is the most interesting of all the wolves, as she can kind of be seen as a split piece of Arya. When Arya is the Night Wolf, that is the only time she feels whole, when with Nymeria. She fishes the dead body of her mother out of a river, she has a real pack, she has power when she is Nymeria. Arya is repeatedly described to have a ‘hole where her heart used to be’, a missing piece of her soul and identity, which is Nymeria. Arya will never be whole until she is back with Nymeria, back with her Stark identity, back with her family. 

Ghost is the other wolf we know the most about, and mostly I interpret wolf as a bit of a clue to Jon’s Targaryen identity, as he is white like the silver hair of the Targs. Ghost is also a very smart direwolf, smarter than Jon I would say, and he is able to scout, find the dead wights in the forest, and generally be the best boy in the universe who deserves pets.

tags: i might have to make this a 'verse
cat burgler arya and chopshop gendry
summary: 42. “I’m only here to establish an alibi.” - sounds like a very AU!Arya statement 🤣
question: 42. “I’m only here to establish an alibi.” - sounds like a very AU!Arya statement 🤣
answer:
“I’m only here to establish an alibi.” 

Gendry slowly sets his keys on the counter. “But you look like you’re robbing me.”

Arya shoves up her ski mask. “What makes you say that?”

His eyes go to her (muddy) black trainers on his table, the canvas bag on the ground, and his unplugged television. “My eyes.”

“I’m not robbing you, stupid,” she says with a huff, leaning her head back on his couch. “No one even owns tube TVs anymore.”

“Then why’d you undo it?”

“Had to charge my phone.”

“There’s an outlet right behind-” he sighs. It’s not worth it. 

Instead, he kicks off his boots, walks in with his hands shoved into his pockets. It’d been a long day without Arya apparently turning his studio apartment into a den of illicit activity. Again. Gendry bows down to his mini fridge, where he withdraws two beers and uses the counter to pop the tops off. He sinks onto the couch beside her, hands her a beer. Her cheek rests on his shoulder and he kisses the top of her head.

“Who’d you actually rob, then?”

“Tywin Lannister.”

Gendry nods. “That’s a good one.” He pulls Arya into his lap–one, because it’s nice to have her there, but two to get her muddy shoes off his table. “I chopped his car a month back.”

“Fuck yes,” Arya says, clinking her bottle to his. “Stick it to the rich people.”

blog.name: buttercuparry
blog.title: Warm Winter Sun
blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

summary: Feels in Arya II from AFFC:
body:
Feels in Arya II from AFFC:

1. Some nights Umma spiced the fish with sea salt and cracked peppercorns, or cooked the eels with chopped garlic. Once in a great while the cook would even use some saffron. Hot Pie would have liked it here, Arya thought.

2. If they are afraid, the candles soothe them. When you smell our candles burning, what does it make you think of, my child?“

Winterfell, she might have said. I smell snow and smoke and pine needles. I smell the stables. I smell Hodor laughing, and Jon and Robb battling in the yard, and Sansa singing about some stupid lady fair. I smell the crypts where the stone kings sit, I smell hot bread baking, I smell the godswood. I smell my wolf, I smell her fur, almost as if she were still beside me. "I don’t smell anything,” she said…

3. “You told me that if I left, I couldn’t come back.”

“Just so.”

Those words made her sad. Syrio used to say that too, Arya remembered. He said it all the time. Syrio Forel had taught her needlework and died for her.

4. I have a hole where my heart should be, she thought, and nowhere else to go.

5. When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies, but the pack survives. She had no pack, though. They had killed her pack, Ser Ilyn and Ser Meryn and the queen, and when she tried to make a new one all of them ran off, Hot Pie and Gendry and Yoren and Lommy Greenhands, even Harwin, who had been her father’s man.

6. Needle seemed to whisper to her. Stick them with the pointy end, it said, and, don’t tell Sansa! Mikken’s mark was on the blade. It’s just a sword. If she needed a sword, there were a hundred under the temple. Needle was too small to be a proper sword, it was hardly more than a toy. She’d been a stupid little girl when Jon had it made for her. “It’s just a sword,” she said, aloud this time …

… but it wasn’t.

Needle was Robb and Bran and Rickon, her mother and her father, even Sansa. Needle was Winterfell’s grey walls, and the laughter of its people. Needle was the summer snows, Old Nan’s stories, the heart tree with its red leaves and scary face, the warm earthy smell of the glass gardens, the sound of the north wind rattling the shutters of her room. Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. He used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.

I’M

blog.name: iheartgot
blog.title: IHEARTGOT
blog.description:
IHEARTGOT is dedicated to the HBO television series Game of Thrones, which is based on the A Song of Ice and Fire novels written by George R. R. Martin, and its cast. We update daily to bring you the latest pictures, edits, gifs and more of the show and the books. 
This is NOT a spoiler-free blog.
We track #iheartgot.

summary: "You gotta give me something to do. There's no way I'm sleeping. Don't you need anyone dead? Or maimed? I can settle for...
body:
“You gotta give me something to do. There’s no way I’m sleeping. Don’t you need anyone dead? Or maimed? I can settle for maimed.”

- Arya Stark

summary: Don’t you think that Sansa is kinda Rhaenys and Arya is kinda Visenya??? I mean there’s a lot of similarities between them
question: Don’t you think that Sansa is kinda Rhaenys and Arya is kinda Visenya??? I mean there’s a lot of similarities between them
answer: Yeah I’ve seen a few gifsets and metas about this. The dynamic is a bit similar but I want to see what it’ll be like in the books before saying it’s an actual parallel.

summary: I should reread all the books again ... but did Arya ever mention the desire to go to the sea and discover new lands rather than...
body: I should reread all the books again … but did Arya ever mention the desire to go to the sea and discover new lands rather than return to Winterfell and find her family (and above all to see her precious brother Jon)? The fact that on the show, Arya explicitly made it clear that she will never return to the North, (Goodbye Sansa & Bran) and not have any desire to visit JON SNOW at Castle Black (and he immediately ACCEPTS it) it seems to me the most absurd thing that I ever seen.

The fact that on the show, Arya explicitly made it clear that she will never return to the North, (Goodbye Sansa & Bran) and not have any desire to visit JON SNOW at Castle Black (and he immediately ACCEPTS it) it seems to me the most absurd thing that I ever seen.

summary: No Better Version of Me  After losing her father, Arya got stuck in neutral - only functioning when beating the piss out of...

No Better Version of Me 

After losing her father, Arya got stuck in neutral - only functioning when beating the piss out of people on the derby track. Gendry is a starving artist with no family and less money.

tags: a song of ice and fire
a song of ice and feels
summary:
Arya: Remember that time you left me for the Brotherhood?
Gendry: Remember that time you left me on the docks?
Arya: Seven...
body:
Arya: Remember that time you left me for the Brotherhood?

Gendry: Remember that time you left me on the docks?

Arya: Seven hells, babe. I turned around and came right back!
